definitions: sweet mixture of sugar and liquid used to cover and decorate cakes
dangerous layer of ice that forms on aircraft surfaces during flight
examples: She spread chocolate icing on the birthday cake
The wedding cake had beautiful white icing with delicate flowers
The pilot reported heavy icing on the wings during the storm
Aircraft icing can severely affect flight performance and safety

definitions: practice of attacking or rejecting cherished beliefs, traditions, or established institutions considered wrong or outdated
historical movement of destroying religious images or icons considered to be heretical or idolatrous
examples: His political iconoclasm challenged every traditional policy in government
The artist's iconoclasm shocked the conservative art establishment completely
Byzantine iconoclasm resulted in widespread destruction of religious artwork
The Protestant Reformation included periods of religious iconoclasm throughout Europe

definitions: person who attacks or criticizes cherished beliefs, traditional institutions, or established practices
historical figure who destroyed religious images or opposed their veneration during iconoclastic movements
examples: The young entrepreneur was an iconoclast who disrupted traditional business
She became an iconoclast in the medical field through revolutionary ideas
Byzantine iconoclasts destroyed countless religious artworks in churches
The iconoclast movement believed that religious images promoted idolatry

definitions: visual images, symbols, or modes of representation collectively associated with a person, movement, or culture
study or interpretation of visual images and symbols, especially in art and religious contexts
examples: The iconography of ancient Egypt includes hieroglyphs and symbolic imagery
Religious iconography helps viewers understand the meaning of sacred art
The museum displayed the complete iconography of medieval Christian art
Pop culture iconography includes instantly recognizable symbols and images

definitions: philosophical theory that reality is fundamentally mental, spiritual, or experiential rather than material
practice of forming or pursuing ideals, especially unrealistically high standards or noble principles
examples: German idealism influenced much of nineteenth century philosophical thought
Plato's idealism posits that true reality exists in perfect forms
Her youthful idealism made her believe she could change the world
Political idealism often clashes with the harsh realities of governance

definitions: person who is guided by ideals, especially one who pursues high or noble principles
philosopher who believes that reality is fundamentally based on mind or ideas rather than material things
examples: The young idealist joined the peace corps to help communities
She remained an idealist despite facing numerous political setbacks repeatedly
Berkeley was an idealist who argued that material objects don't exist
German idealists like Hegel transformed European philosophical thinking profoundly

definitions: process of regarding or representing something as perfect or better than it actually is in reality
examples: His idealization of rural life ignored its many hardships completely
The artist's idealization of the human form created impossibly perfect figures
Media idealization of relationships creates unrealistic expectations for many people
Her idealization of her deceased father prevented honest family discussions

definitions: formation of ideas or concepts, especially in creative or problem-solving contexts within organizations or therapy
examples: The design team spent hours in ideation sessions brainstorming solutions
Suicidal ideation requires immediate professional mental health intervention and support
Creative ideation workshops help companies develop innovative product concepts regularly
The therapist assessed the patient's ideation patterns during counseling sessions

definitions: something that identifies or distinguishes a person, thing, or category from others
sequence of characters used to identify or refer to a program, file, user, or data element in computing
examples: Your employee identifier number is required for building access
The unique identifier helps track packages throughout the shipping process
Each variable needs a unique identifier in the programming code
The system assigns an identifier to every user account automatically

definitions: person who adheres rigidly to a particular ideology, especially in politics, often with extreme or uncompromising views
examples: The political ideologue refused to consider any opposing viewpoints whatsoever
Party ideologues pushed for increasingly extreme policy positions each year
The economic ideologue ignored practical evidence that contradicted his theories
Religious ideologues often clash with moderate members of their faith

definitions: group of words established by usage as having meaning not deducible from individual words
examples: The idiom 'break a leg' actually means to wish someone luck
English learners often struggle with idioms like 'piece of cake'
Regional idioms can confuse visitors who take them literally sometimes
The idiom 'raining cats and dogs' describes very heavy rainfall

definitions: state of not being active, employed, or in use for a period of time
examples: The factory machines sat idle during the economic downturn period
Workers complained about long idle periods between production runs daily
The car engine shouldn't be left idle for extended time periods
During idle moments, she would sketch in her notebook quietly

definitions: person who avoids work or spends time doing nothing productive or useful
wheel or roller that turns freely, used to guide or tension a belt or chain
examples: The village idler spent his days sitting outside the cafe
Don't be an idler when there's important work to complete
The conveyor belt's idler wheel needed replacement after years of use
Adjust the idler to maintain proper chain tension on the bicycle

definitions: state of an engine running slowly while disconnected from a load or out of gear
examples: The taxi was idling outside while waiting for passengers to arrive
Excessive idling wastes fuel and increases air pollution in cities
The boat engine was idling smoothly at the dock before departure
Modern cars consume less fuel while idling than older models

definitions: physical object or image worshipped as a deity or representation of a god
person who is greatly admired, loved, or revered, especially a celebrity or performer
examples: Ancient civilizations created elaborate idols from gold and precious stones
The golden idol was discovered in the temple ruins after centuries
The pop star became an idol to millions of teenage fans
Sports idols inspire young athletes to pursue their dreams passionately

definitions: worship of idols, images, or physical objects as representations of deities
excessive admiration, love, or reverence for something or someone to an extreme degree
examples: The prophet condemned idolatry and urged worship of one god
Ancient idolatry rituals involved offerings to carved stone figures regularly
His idolatry of wealth led him to sacrifice family relationships
Celebrity idolatry has reached unhealthy levels in modern society today

definitions: extremely happy, peaceful, or picturesque episode or scene, typically idealized or unsustainable
short poem or prose piece describing a picturesque scene or incident, especially in rural life
examples: Their summer cottage provided an idyll away from city stress
The rural idyll was shattered by news of approaching war
Their brief romantic idyll ended when reality intruded upon them
The poet wrote an idyll celebrating simple country pleasures beautifully

definitions: dome-shaped dwelling made of blocks of solid snow, traditionally used by Inuit peoples
examples: The hunters built an igloo for shelter during the Arctic expedition
Traditional igloo construction requires specific knowledge of snow properties carefully
The children made a small igloo in the backyard after snowfall
Museum exhibits show how igloos provided warmth in freezing temperatures

definitions: action of setting something on fire or starting to burn through heat or spark
mechanism for firing the explosive mixture in an internal combustion engine's cylinders
examples: The ignition of dry leaves caused the forest fire to spread
Spontaneous ignition can occur in oily rags left in heat
Turn the key in the ignition to start your car engine
The mechanic replaced the faulty ignition system components yesterday afternoon

definitions: large tropical American lizard with a spiny crest along the back and greenish coloration
examples: The green iguana basked on a rock in the afternoon sun
Wild iguanas are common in Central and South American forests
Pet iguanas require specialized care including heat lamps and proper diet
The marine iguana is unique to the Galapagos Islands ecosystem

definitions: type, sort, or class of people or things sharing similar characteristics or qualities
examples: Politicians of his ilk rarely keep their campaign promises honestly
I don't associate with people of that ilk anymore these days
Restaurants of this ilk cater to wealthy clientele exclusively nowadays
Writers of her ilk focus on deep psychological character development

definitions: harm, evil, or misfortune that affects someone or something in various forms
examples: The policy change brought more ill than good to communities
She wished him no ill despite their past disagreements together
Social ills like poverty require comprehensive solutions from government leaders
The doctor worked tirelessly to cure society's ills through medicine

definitions: state or quality of being contrary to or forbidden by law, rules, or regulations
examples: The illegality of the contract became apparent during the audit
Lawyers argued about the illegality of the government's surveillance program
The company faced charges due to illegality in their hiring practices
Questions of illegality arose when examining the financial transactions carefully

definitions: state of being not authorized by law or not in accordance with accepted standards
state of being born to parents who are not married to each other
examples: The illegitimacy of the regime led to international sanctions quickly
Constitutional scholars debated the illegitimacy of the emergency powers claimed
Historical illegitimacy carried social stigma for children and mothers alike
The novel explored themes of illegitimacy in Victorian society thoroughly

definitions: person or thing not authorized by law or not conforming to accepted rules or standards
examples: The illegitimate claimant to the throne was quickly exposed and exiled
Security identified several illegitimate tickets at the concert venue entrance
The committee declared the election results illegitimate due to fraud
An illegitimate business operated without proper licenses for years

definitions: inability to read or write, or lack of knowledge in a particular subject or area
examples: Adult illiteracy remains a significant problem in many developing nations
The charity focuses on combating illiteracy through free education programs
Financial illiteracy leads many people into debt and poor investments
Computer illiteracy limits job opportunities in the modern digital economy

definitions: person who is unable to read or write, or lacking knowledge in a specific area
examples: The illiterate farmer relied on his children to read important documents
Many illiterate adults feel ashamed and hide their inability effectively
He was financially illiterate despite his advanced engineering degree impressively
Computer illiterate employees struggled with the new digital systems daily

definitions: lighting or light provided to make something visible or bright for practical purposes
decorative colored lights used to enhance the appearance of buildings or spaces
clarification or spiritual enlightenment that helps understanding of truth or knowledge
examples: The street illumination improved safety in the neighborhood significantly
Proper illumination is essential for detailed artwork restoration work
The castle's illumination during festivals attracts thousands of tourists annually
Christmas illumination transforms the city into a magical wonderland
The teacher's explanation provided illumination on the complex topic
Meditation brought spiritual illumination to the troubled seeker gradually

definitions: entertainer who performs tricks and illusions to create seemingly impossible or supernatural feats
examples: The famous illusionist made an elephant disappear on stage tonight
Professional illusionists guard their secrets and methods very carefully always
The street illusionist amazed crowds with simple yet effective card tricks
Master illusionists combine showmanship with technical skill and misdirection effectively

definitions: artist who creates images, drawings, or designs to accompany or enhance written text
examples: The children's book illustrator brought the story to life beautifully
Fashion illustrators sketch designs for magazines and advertising campaigns regularly
The medical illustrator creates detailed anatomical drawings for textbooks precisely
Freelance illustrators often work on multiple projects simultaneously throughout months

definitions: visual images collectively, especially in art, media, or mental pictures formed in imagination
figurative language, especially metaphors and similes, used in literature to represent ideas
examples: The film's dark imagery created an atmosphere of suspense throughout
Satellite imagery helps scientists monitor environmental changes over time
The poet's vivid imagery transported readers to distant landscapes immediately
Religious imagery appears frequently in Renaissance paintings and sculptures

definitions: something that exists only in imagination or fantasy rather than in physical reality
examples: Children often have imaginary friends during their early developmental years
The novelist created an imaginary world with its own unique rules
His fears were based on imaginary threats rather than real danger
The imaginary line of the equator divides Earth into hemispheres

definitions: process of creating visual representations of objects, areas, or phenomena using various technologies
examples: Medical imaging techniques help doctors diagnose diseases without invasive procedures
Satellite imaging provides crucial data for weather prediction and mapping
Digital imaging has revolutionized photography and graphic design industries completely
Brain imaging reveals how different areas activate during specific tasks

definitions: person who leads prayers in a mosque and provides religious guidance to Muslim communities
examples: The imam delivered a powerful sermon about compassion and justice
Local imams play crucial roles in their communities beyond leading prayers
The young imam studied Islamic theology for many years abroad
Community members seek guidance from their imam on religious matters

definitions: lack of proportion or equilibrium between corresponding parts, forces, or aspects of something
examples: The trade imbalance between the two countries caused economic tension
Hormonal imbalance can affect mood and physical health significantly
Power imbalance in relationships often leads to unhealthy dynamics developing
The ecosystem suffered from imbalance after invasive species were introduced

definitions: thing made to look like something else, typically something more expensive or valuable
action of copying someone or something, often as a form of learning or flattery
examples: The museum gift shop sells imitation artifacts for visitors
Cheap imitation leather doesn't last as long as genuine material
Children learn through imitation of adult behaviors and speech patterns
His imitation of the celebrity's voice was remarkably accurate

definitions: person who copies the behavior, appearance, or actions of another, sometimes professionally
examples: The Elvis imitator performed at weddings and corporate events regularly
Fashion imitators quickly copy designer trends for mass market production
Successful business models attract many imitators in competitive markets quickly
The comedian was known as a brilliant imitator of political figures

definitions: state of not being fully developed physically, emotionally, or intellectually for one's age
examples: His emotional immaturity showed in how he handled workplace conflicts
The fruit's immaturity meant it needed more time to ripen properly
Financial immaturity led to poor spending decisions and mounting debt
The writer's early work showed immaturity but great potential nonetheless

definitions: quality of bringing one into direct and instant involvement with something, giving rise to urgency
examples: The immediacy of social media changed how news spreads globally
Live television provides immediacy that recorded programs cannot match effectively
The crisis demanded immediacy in government response to save lives
Digital communication offers immediacy but sometimes lacks personal connection completely

definitions: deep mental or physical involvement in a particular activity, situation, or environment
action of immersing someone or something completely in a liquid or substance
examples: Language immersion programs help students learn more effectively and quickly
Virtual reality provides complete immersion in digital environments for users
The baptism ceremony involved full immersion in the river water
Cold water immersion therapy has become popular among athletes recently

definitions: state of not being able to move or be moved physically, or inability to change
examples: The patient's immobility required constant care from nursing staff members
Traffic immobility during rush hour frustrates commuters in major cities
Social immobility prevents people from improving their economic status easily
The statue's immobility contrasted with the flowing water around it

definitions: action of preventing something from moving or operating normally, especially for medical treatment
examples: Fracture immobilization prevents further damage and promotes proper healing naturally
The thief used a steering wheel lock for vehicle immobilization
Asset immobilization during legal proceedings protects disputed property from sale
Proper immobilization techniques are essential for emergency medical responders

definitions: act of killing or sacrificing someone or something, especially by burning as an offering
examples: Self-immolation protests have occurred throughout history as political statements
Ancient rituals sometimes included animal immolation to appease gods
The monk's immolation sparked international attention to the political crisis
Symbolic immolation of effigies occurs during some cultural festivals annually

definitions: behavior that is contrary to accepted principles of right and wrong conduct in society
examples: The company's immorality in dumping waste angered local residents greatly
Religious leaders condemned the immorality they saw in modern entertainment
Financial immorality among executives led to the corporation's downfall eventually
The novel explores themes of immorality and redemption throughout its pages

definitions: being that lives forever or is remembered forever, often in mythology or literature
examples: Greek mythology features many immortal gods and goddesses with human traits
The author became immortal through her timeless literary works
Legends speak of immortal warriors who cannot die in battle
Scientists search for ways to make human cells immortal theoretically

definitions: ability to live forever or never die, often attributed to gods or sought by humans
state of being remembered forever through one's achievements, works, or influence
examples: Many religions promise immortality to faithful believers after death
Ancient emperors sought immortality through magical elixirs and rituals
Artists achieve immortality through masterpieces that endure across centuries
The scientist's discoveries granted her immortality in academic history

definitions: object that cannot be moved or changed in position, legally referring to property like land
examples: The ancient monument stood as an immovable reminder of history
Legal documents distinguish between movable and immovable property assets clearly
The immovable boulder blocked the mountain path for centuries continuously
Immovable feast days occur on the same calendar date annually

definitions: process of making a person or animal immune to infection, typically by vaccination
examples: Childhood immunisation programs have eliminated many dangerous diseases successfully
The clinic offers free immunisation services to low-income families regularly
Travel immunisation requirements vary depending on destination countries visited frequently
Herd immunisation protects vulnerable individuals who cannot receive vaccines directly

definitions: ability of an organism to resist infection or disease through biological defense mechanisms
protection or exemption from something, especially legal prosecution or obligation
examples: Natural immunity develops after recovering from certain infectious diseases completely
Vaccines provide immunity without causing the actual disease symptoms
Diplomatic immunity protects embassy staff from prosecution in host countries
The witness received immunity in exchange for testimony against criminals
